msItem.title: Minneliederen
msItem.incipit: So schiir si toent haer doeght ...
msItem.note: F. 1v inc. def.: ... Dan dat te draghen; f. 2r inc.: Wat draf mach comen ... ; both leaves have holes but with a loss of text only on f. 2.

collation.p: Bifolium, cropped in upper margin, used as binding material.

layout.p: 2 columns, 140 x 120-130 mm. Rooth estimates the original size of the leaf to have been ca. 240 x 160 mm.; catch word at f. 2v.

handDesc.p: Gothic minuscule from first half of 14th century.

decoNote.p: Initials are not filled or decorated.

binding.p: Parchment case binding, Sweden 20th century. Size: 210 x 175 x 8 mm.
Parchment case over millboards. Two white leather ties at fore-edge. Parchment pastedowns. The bifolio manuscript of parchment is mounted on parchment guard.

foliation.p: Foliated in pencil by modern cataloguer in upper right corner.

origin.p: Holland (Limburg or Brabant?; the dialect is of the Limburg area), early 14th century.

acquisition.p: The manuscript was discovered in 1926 by Erik Rooth (1889-1986, professor of German studies at Lund University) in Lund University Library in a portfolio containing several unidentified fragments.

source.p: Catalogued by Margarete Andersson-Schmitt, the manuscript description encoded in June of 2002 by Eva Nilsson Nylander.
